level.heading: Amendment or restatement of certificate of organization.

level.text: A certificate of organization may be amended or restated at any time.
To amend its certificate of organization, a limited liability company shall deliver to the Mayor for filing an amendment stating:
The date of filing of its certificate of organization; and
The changes the amendment makes to the certificate as most recently amended or restated.
To restate its certificate of organization, a limited liability company shall deliver to the Mayor for filing a restatement, designated as such in its heading, stating:
In the heading or an introductory paragraph, the company's present name and the date of the filing of the company's initial certificate of organization;
If the company's name has been changed at any time since the company's formation, each of the company's former names; and
The changes the restatement makes to the certificate as most recently amended or restated.
Subject to §§ 29-801.09(c) and 29-802.05(c), an amendment to or restatement of a certificate of organization shall be effective when filed by the Mayor.

If a member of a member-managed limited liability company, or a manager of a manager-managed limited liability company, knows that any information in a filed certificate of organization was inaccurate when the certificate was filed or has become inaccurate owing to changed circumstances, the member or manager shall promptly:
Cause the certificate to be amended; or
If appropriate, deliver to the Mayor for filing a statement of change under §§ 29-104.07 through 29-104.10 or a statement of correction under § 29-102.05.

A limited liability company may amend its certificate of organization to delete the information required by § 29-802.01(b)(2) at any time after it has filed its first biennial report under § 29-102.11.
